Other.label: Horizon Line
Other.tooltip: Perspective tool, to calculate the position of the horizon-line and vanishing point.

Keying.label: Kill Outline
Keying.tooltip:
KillOutline reduces unwanted outlines from keyed footage.

erode controls: erode the alpha in for the amount of the visible outline.

expand controls: expand outer pixels of eroded image out again until it reaches the edge of the original alpha.

transition treatment: if needed, blur the transition between original image and extension.

2.5D.label: Relight
2.5D.tooltip:
Relights a 2D image based on rendered point positions and normal vectors in the vec input.  It also uses a camera to calculate specular.

Currently the cone in the spotlight light type matches the Nuke spotlight closely but not exactly, and the cone falloff knob is unsupported.

Additional features are diffuse wrap for simulating fill light, and energy conserving normalized specular, meaning that the specular intensity increases and decreases proportional to shininess

2.5D.label: Rotate Normal
2.5D.tooltip:
This will rotate Normal-data using rotation matrixes.
You enable Normal-data in the ScanlineRender-node, create a new layer for this.

Tip 1:
 Link the rotation knob to the Nuke camera, revert the camera order and then either invert the matrixes or negate the angles.
This will convert the Normal data from World Space to Camera Space.

2.5D.label: Bump Normals
2.5D.tooltip: Generate bump for a 3D normals pass in world space.  The input bump texture can either be flat or a 3D render.

Colour.label: GradeAOV
Colour.tooltip:
Colour correct the CG beauty using the secondary(aov) passes.with a subtractive process.
to be used when:
 * the CG is good and only a few passes need adjusting
 * the secondaries don't add up to the beauty
 * rgb saturation (luminance mix on)
 * rgb contrast (with pivot)
 * matting with external mask input or main channel input or both with an operation.
 The order of correction is: Grade Node>Contrast Node>Saturation.

Image.label: UV Tile
Image.tooltip:
Creates a proceedural UV map that can be used to check the UVs on any object. It is normalised in U and V so using a colour sample with allow you to
check the UV location of any point on the model. it is STRONGLY recommended that you only output to Square formats (1:1 aspect ratio)

Transform.label: Camera Shake (Vector Motion Blur)
Transform.tooltip:
Combines vectors from an input with camera shake vectors for motion blur;

* presets
* tiling
* pre-transform paramaters
* combining two noise patterns together i.e. handheld & vibration)
* being able to view the output curves with time offsets to place 'bumps' at the right moment in time
* seperate amplitude and frequency for Transform, scale and rotation

Filter.label: Fractal Blur
Filter.tooltip: Organic distortion an rgba using a mask. Example use: break up an edge or create a stylistic effect
